title: The Parable Of The Walls - Byrne Power
description:
Here is a strange parable of a man on simple walk down the road. But what is the point of the story? 
.....
Since I can't get monetized I need your help. PLEASE SUPPORT THIS CHANNEL, Do consider a monthly contribution through PayPal to receive extra content and to help me afloat here in Georgia. And if you start today you can get 10 hours worth of extra content immediately. ($10 per month or more  OR $50 plus in one gift.)
Click this... 
https://www.paypal.com/donate?hosted_button_id=GE5NHN8AYL3YC

Watch this video for more about receiving extra content: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nykTp3TziRY
......

The Anadromous Life essay site for more in depth ideas:  https://theanadromist.wordpress.com/ Visit my Gravity From Above channel is this one: https://www.youtube.com/user/gulagzero 

The Gravity From Above site for more artistic ideas involving puppetry, music, dance and other arts.   https://gravityfromabove.wordpress.com/ 

And to understand more about my life in Georgia check out my Georgian Crossroads channel: 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCeFJ6Tm71ieNcjcUb-Trc8g

And if you want to communicate with me use The Anadromous Life Facebook page. 
https://www.facebook.com/theanadromist/ 
(I don't want to have to make my personal page private because I have too many 'friends'. If it's dialogue you want go there. I'll start 'community' page soon enough if the demand is there.) 

Thanks for watching, more coming soon! 
Meanwhile dig into the Anadromous past. 
From Tbilisi Georgia (Look it up on a map!) 
Swimming Against the Stream

Byrne

#byrnepower #parables #theanadromist

transcript_parts.text: [Music]
we're going to devote our energies to
sports and gardening all the cultural
pursuits as far as they're concerned in
fact we're going to put the dooms to
sleep
meanwhile we dig
the parable of the walls
a man was walking along life's road on
his way to self-discovery and
understanding
sure life on the road gets difficult
things happen to cause anger confusion
betrayal but he wasn't concerned about
it
because he knew that everything was an
opportunity for growth
and that nothing really would stop him
he would meet people along the way from
time to time
he stopped and talked chit chat clever
words
modest bragging some passed him
running as if from a fire others
he passed as they dawdled along the way
some walking the other direction
gave him curious looks as they passed
one day he was walking down the road
and he squinted and saw something in the
distance
at first it seemed just like a line
across the horizon
but as he moved closer he could see that
it was a stone wall
a long high stone wall taller than
himself
he looked along the horizon but he
couldn't see a way around it
and so he approached the wall and he
stopped
and he thought
[Music]
he felt he had to continue in the
direction he was going
it was after all the road to finding
himself
and that was after all the point to life
as he steadied the situation for a time
he noticed vines growing up the walls
he pulled on them they were strong
enough to hold him
so he tugged and heaved himself and got
to the top of the wall
he was indeed right the road continued
on before him
and so with confidence he jumped down
from the wall
glad to feel his legs beneath him
then he resumed his walk
now he continued on the road
occasionally stopping to talk to others
about that strange wall
it seemed purposely to be put there for
some reason
it took some effort to climb up it
but in the end it was no problem at all
and he felt stronger for it it didn't
kill him after all
and now he walked and walked sometimes
he was tired by his endless
perambulation
nevertheless he knew that the exercise
was doing him good
he passed villages and trees and farms
bees humming in the fields
flowers blooming a lovely girl waved to
him from a distance
he stopped for a moment to spend time
with her and then he continued
what a pleasant walk it was yet
he couldn't stop he had a destination
but as he walked and walked he began to
feel irritations in his shoes
but the road ahead enticed him and so he
continued
until he looked ahead and saw a line
across the horizon
it was similar to the first but darker
more pronounced and when he arrived he
saw that it was indeed another stone
wall
much taller than the first
again there seemed no way around it and
so he looked and found another vine
growing against the wall
this time however the vine seemed older
more fragile
but it would still hold him and the
stone wall was slightly flatter
but he huffed and puffed and boosted
himself to the top
it was a long way up the view from
behind was obscured by a row of trees
but the road seemed to continue before
him
if more overgrown and falling from this
height would
probably hurt but he felt he could
probably just jump down
if he were careful and so with a lurch
he tumbled down hitting the ground
rolling
yet spraining his ankle in the process
he stood up in some pain dusted himself
off
and found that he could walk on his
bruised leg though
with some throbbing and yet as he looked
down the road he could sense a wasteful
call forward onto a becoming
to an arrival and so he marched on
the land was now wilder the trees seemed
past the turning point of summer
still lush yet brittle at one point
he passed a woman under a tree off
to the side of the road she was scuffed
and had with her a young boy in dirty
clothes
a hand was held outstretched he searched
his pockets and found a few coins
she thanked him with a strange look in
her eyes
and as he walked he felt guilty because
his coins could do so little for her
and yet he had to find himself
and the rocky road beckoned through a
gnarling forest of blighted trees
he walked on and on his ankles pain
remained a constant friend he could feel
blisters developing
the woods seem thicker now more
impenetrable
and then up ahead around a bend in the
road seemingly out of nowhere
another wall emerged
this wall was dark missing stones
yet it was massive in comparison to the
last wall
his heart sank but then he felt he had
to try to get around it
he thought for a moment about turning
back and retracing his journey but the
idea of climbing those walls again
didn't appeal to him besides
what was there at the beginning of his
journey
and then he thought of the eyes of the
pleading woman he couldn't face them
again and even worse the strange sickly
eyes of her son
and so he looked at the wall and said
let's do this now there was no single
vine to help him climb up the wall
rather it was a combination of branches
from trees holes in the wall from
missing stones and just plain willpower
that brought him some time later with
scratched fingers to the top of the
titanic wall
this time you could see that the wall
curved around a mountain which lay
before him
and further up he could see a castle or
fortification
and he smiled to himself now the effort
would pay off
now he could do it behind him lay a
darkening opaque landscape
but ahead of him the light rested
brightly on the hill
and so all he had to do was descend the
wall
and move forth along the small trail
before him
but that was easier said than done there
was no obvious
way down he walked along the ridge of
the wall
looking for something at last he came to
an iron rod protruding from the wall
attached to it was an old rope this was
the way down
others had been here before him only the
best he thought to himself make it this
far on the road
he held on to the old rope and started
to move hand over hand
slowly downwards the distance below
frightened him
and the strength of his hands was not
what he thought it was
his muscles spasmed he lost his grip
slightly and began
sliding down the dry rope his hand
singed and
burned in writhing torture as he slid
and it was too fast he gave one last
attempt to halt the slide but it didn't
stop him
and suddenly there was no more rope he
fell through the air
hitting his elbows and knees on the wall
and then the ground met him
with a complete thudding disdain
he lay there stunned and exhausted
his head was scraped and pulsing his
joints bruised even bleeding
he slowly tried to stand his body
would scarcely obey him but then again
his will was nearly absent as well
but in the darkening gloom he could make
out the trail
and so he limped over to it the leaves
on the trees were falling here
and he pulled an old branch from the
side of the weedy trail
and used it to steady his loping gate
he conjured up within himself a state of
satisfaction at having accomplished so
difficult to feed
he continued to hike up the hill on the
lonely pathway
the terrain grew steeper and rougher
at times he wasn't even sure it was a
path anymore
and then in the dark wood he noticed a
pair of eyes
canine eyes following him
he ignored it in his slow ascent
but it did not ignore him he turned and
looked in the looming dusk
and could make out a large black dog
patting steadily on his trail
he felt his stick to use it as a club if
he had to
the dog came imperturbably after him
beads of sweat streamed down his scarred
face
he braced himself for a fight but none
ever came
suddenly before him were the walls of
the curved citadel rising out of the
mound
into the darkening sky illuminated by
the full moon as much as by the last
shards
of light shooting through the land
and then his heart broke he looked and
saw how high the wall was
he thought of his battered body his
fingers were hideously scabbed and
stinging now
this wall was ten times higher than the
last the dog came up to him
and stared at him steadily as if trying
to tell him something
he looked down the hill and could see
two other shapes moving towards him
he looked around at the wall and saw a
great tree that ascended
into the air next to the wall
this is the way he said aloud
the great black dog placed a step
towards him
he began to climb up the tree with some
difficulty
and yet it seemed as if there was indeed
a well-worn pattern and so he heaved
himself up
straining and grunting as he went soon
the ground below
seemed distant insignificant the dog lay
there waiting
the other shapes came into view but he
could not identify them
at one point he was stopped by something
in his way
the skeleton of another man nestled in
one of the bows of the tree
it was dry wearing raggedy clothes and a
pained smile on his face
it smelled of rancid meat he tried to
get by it
but knocked it over instead causing the
skull
to snap off and fall down to the bottom
sending a strange noise up from below
but he couldn't think about that he had
to keep ascending
then he came to a choice the branches of
the tall tree were intermeshed with the
old crumbling stairway
on the upper outer zone of the fortress
he could
leave the tree or he could continue up
it
he paused and chose the stairway on the
outer edge of the wall
he tentatively leapt from a vine
encrusted branch
to the stone steps he began to move
slowly all the while
hugging the wall and staying away from
the perilous side of the ledge
he moved up and around as well
the tree and the darkness kept him
nearly in a state of blindness
though he had glimpses of the moon from
time to time
but he climbed and he climbed until at
last he came to what felt like the end
of the stairs
and below him yawned the distance
yet it wasn't the end of his journey
there were remnants of the stairway and
empty holes for feet and hands
and so he continued trying to climb up
the side of the wall
all the while payne wracked his body
and bitter resolve impelled him on as he
felt for the next toe hold
as he felt that sudden death would
overwhelm him
in the gulf below yet
he wanted his reward after all he
deserved it
he would finally find himself here on
this mountain
on the top of this citadel at length
with extreme
effort he pulled his body up to the
highest rung on the wall
he lay there on the top ready for an
epiphany
he raised himself up and looked ahead of
him
and saw only a black concentric abyss
falling straight
below
it was merely a circular wall
like a large brick smokestack
he turned and looked backwards and in
the light of the full moon
he could see that he had been moving
steadily
into the center of a vast encirclement
of walls stretching on forever
and now he understood the looks of the
people he had passed at the beginning
who were going the opposite direction
far below him the black dog whimpered
turned and walked away
a people without yesterday is not
redeemed
for history is a pattern of timeless
[Music]
moments
[Music]
you
